Recipe.title: Cheap Soft Toffee
Recipe.Description: When Ransom was growing up, his family used to visit Canada every few years. One of Ransom's favorite treats up there was " MacIntosh's Creamy Toffee". Ransom tried many recipes to duplicate it and came up with a really good one. However, it requires some ingredients that we rarely have on hand. So, this recipe is not quite as good, and you have to be a bit more careful, but it is good.

section.instruction: Lightly spray a 9&inch; &by; 13&inch; pan with non-stick spray.
In a large, non-stick pot, combine all ingredients except Vanilla.
Heat mixture on medium, using a candy thermometer to monitor temperature.

Stirring very frequently, heat to 253° F. (This will take half an hour or so.)
(I know 253° sounds weird, but 250° leaves it runny, and 255° makes it brittle.)
When it reaches temperature, immediately remove the pot from the heat.
Pour mixture onto the prepared pan and spread evenly.

Notes.note: Warning! Mixture will more than double while heating, then will reduce as it nears the correct temperature.
Although the original recipe is cooked on high, this one is intentionally cooked on medium. If you cook it higher, small flecks begin to form which makes it look bad.

Cutting it up is a challenge. I used a hot, large, sharp chopping knife, and was able to get it if I was patient.
Alternatively, you can cut it when it is mostly cool, but you need to place the cut pieces around so they don' t touch.

Modifications.modification: About a minute after pouring the mixture into the prepared pan, sprinkle it with about 1 Cup Chocolate Chips. Let sit for another 2 minutes, then spread the now softened Chocolate Chips with a spatula. Then let cool normally.
